document_data.name: Blue Ring Octopus
document_data.refs2e: {{Cite dragon/227/The Dragon's Bestiary: Monsters of the Underdark|30}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Blue ring octopi''' were a species of sentient [[octopus]] found in the [[Underdark]].
document_data.Description:
Blue ring octopi looked like a regular octopi but much larger. Their tentacles could grow to up to {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}} in length. Their eyes were large and golden-hued and their beaks were a greenish-brown. Their skin was covered in hundreds of small blue circles.

Some blue ring octopi were born with rings of deep oxblood red and grew to be even larger than others of their species. They were known as '''red shamans''' or '''shaman blue rings'''.
document_data.Personality: Despite their size, blue ring octopi were shy creatures. They were highly intelligent and good-natured and were committed pacifists..
document_data.Abilities:
Like most octopi, the skin of a blue ring octopus was saturated with chromatophores. This gave the blue ring octopus excellent camouflage. They could vary the color of their skin from a dirty gray to a dark gray-brown.

In fact, its camouflaged was so effective that it was capable of altering how light was reflected off its skin. This provided a blue ring octopus with camouflage against creatures who used [[infravision]] or [[ultravision]] to see.

Red shamans lacked this ability but were capable of casting powerful [[divine]] [[spell]]s.
document_data.Combat: Blue ring octopi avoided combat when possible, preferring to evade a potentially hostile creatures. However, if forced into combat, blue ring octopi were fierce fighters. In melee combat, they used their powerful tentacles, which were poisonous, to grab and then constrict an opponent. Blue ring octopi released a poisonous cloud of [[ink]] as a defensive measure. It released enough ink to fill a sphere with a {{SIAdj|20|ft|long=yes}} radius. The poison affected any water-breathing creature as well as any creature using magic to breath water.
document_data.Society:
Red shamans were the [[priest]]s of blue ring octopi society. They were considered wise by other blue ring octopi and provided advice to their tribes. It was not known what, if any, [[deity]] they worshiped to acquire their divine powers.

They were known to make intricate carvings out of coral and exchanged these with friendly sea-dwellers.
document_data.Ecology: Blue ring octopi were nomadic and lived together in small tribes within the oceans of the Underdark. Occasionally they found a passage to the bottom of a surface ocean, where they lived in the dark, cold waters of the ocean depths. They made their homes in cracks and crevices in the seabed and tried to avoid detection by the more dangerous creatures of the oceans.
document_data.Realms: Blue ring octopi maintained an underwater realm called Suswynfa within the waters of the [[Giant's Chalice]], a subterranean lake below the [[Western Heartlands]].
document_data.Relationships: Blue ring octopi had a co-operative relationship with [[locathah]] and [[tako]]. Those of Suswynfa traded and had allies in the [[sea elf]] realm of [[Naramyr]].
document_data.Uses: [[Aboleth]]s and [[kuo-toa]] were known to capture blue ring octopi to use them as slaves. Enslaved blue ring octopi were usually treated well. Blue ring octopi had the uncanny ability to know when another one of their species were being held as slaves, and used whatever means necessary to free them.
